Name: Balloons
Description:
All are playing with the purpose to take all the balloons to the sun before it is obscured by the cloud.
Place the sky tiles one after the other to form a path from the children to the sun. Place all the balloons on the starting tile. Place the cloud on the first sky tile.
The current player rolls the rainbow dice:
-Balloon face, the balloon with the corresponding colour moves forward to the following free sky tile;
-Wind face, you can choose which balloon to move;
-Cloud face, the cloud moves forward a tile.
If all the balloons arrive at the tile with the sun before the cloud, all players have won together!

Name: Playroom
Description:
Let’s put in order the highest number of toys exactly recalling where they have been placed.

Place the chest of drawers on the table. Place the 6 toy tiles facedown in front of the drawers. Take a set of 12 shoe tiles.
The current player takes a tile from the toy table, showing it to all, and puts it into any of the drawers. The turn passes to the next player, who will do likewise with the constraint of storing the card in the drawer below the previous one. The last two toy tiles stay on the table and will be considered as they were put on the floor.
Shuffle toy cards and assemble a card deck. Turn over all the cards, one at a time. All together the players should try to remember where to find that toy: place on the card a shoe tile with the colour of the drawer or with floor face up.

Now check the actual position of the toys: did you recall where all toys have been placed? You won!

Name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Solo Play A.I. Deck
Description:
The Martians have a mind of their own! Take command of the heroes of Greenville and team up against an AI-driven Martian force, powered by this deck of cards. Now you can play co-operatively against the Martians or face the threat solo.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gravity Stones
Description:
This project was dropped and the game has never been published.

Day 1: It has been confirmed that what is now called "gravity stones" arose last night. Crystalline rock formations levitate in mid-air, resulting in a great decrease in the gravity around them.The potential benefits are enormous and the seven days we have to study them won't be wasted, be sure of it.

Gravity Stones is a development and optimization game with multiple choices in a brief playing time. The game plays over the course of seven rounds. Each round, a simultaneous first phase allows the players to play cards from their hand on the action side or on the resource side, also discarding one of them onto the central (company)

The second phase is individual, and starts with the first player, who uses their actions and resources (if needed) to establish a camp on the mountain, to study the stones, or to construct ZeroG tools from them. Once your actions are spent, you can either recover one of the cards left by the players or leave them; you will be punished or rewarded based on your choice.

With its intertwined actions and grant system, Gravity Stones allows you to augment your base actions with the stones you get back from the central board. The company that's hired you will also give you objectives to fulfill...or not.

Name: Winnetou 2
Description:
Game 1: Prärie-Kampf (2 players or 2 teams)
Each player or team starts with 8 pawns on the red and blue outher spaces of their camp area. The goal is to get 4 pawns into the 4 camp area spaces in the corners of the enemy camp. Movement is determined by rolling a die. If a pawn gets on a space with an enemy pawn, the later gets captured. If a pawn reaches a destination space, one friendly captured pawn gets free.

Game 2: Verfolgungsjagd (Pachisi, 2-4 players)

Name: Battlestations!
Description:
Sirens split the black... BATTLESTATIONS! Control mighty battlecruisers facing off against each other in deep space. Use programmed actions to launch fighters and torpedos, fire lasers, and even unleash your railgun! Every move counts when the cold embrace of space awaits outside...

Players control two battlecruisers fighting across an imaginary grid of 3x2 cards. Weapons are played into the columns and move over to the opponent's cruiser in an attempt to cause damage. Each player has a command queue that they load cards into the back of and execute from the front of. This queue is played face up so your opponent has an idea of what you intend to do, but each card has two options so you are never sure what is going to happen.

It works like a two-player space invaders, with weapon cards moving across the space between cruisers and causing damage if they reach the other side. With only three hit points for each cruiser, it is intended to be a quick dueling game.

Name: Mystic Vale: Conclave
Description: Mystic Vale: Conclave provides the ideal storage solution designed to hold all of the previous releases, with room to spare for future expansions! The new Equinox mechanic allows players to greatly speed up gameplay and can even scale up to 6–player games with the two additional starter decks provided. The new conclaves grant players the option to customize the starting decks of advancements and vales, creating a new play experience each game. Unique totem cards imbue players with awesome abilities they can use each turn, to truly feel the power of Gaia’s blessing. Spirit counters provide a way for players to track their spirit symbols during their turn.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Andrea Booster
Description:
Andrea, a former law clerk, was left stranded when returning her sister Amy to college. They were picked up by Dale and helped form the original survivor group. Acting as the team sentry, Andrea began to display a crucial survival skill – marksmanship.

Contains:

1x Andrea Miniature
1x Amy Miniature
1x Walker Miniature
Character Cards
Equipment Cards
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: BattleCON:  Merjoram Alexian Crown Princess of Jeffreys
Description: A single character expansion to be used with all Battlecon Base sets.

Name: BattleCON: Jin the Dark King
Description: A single character expansion for any of the BattleCON base sets.

Name: BattleCON: Raritti Sikhar Cartomancer
Description: A single character expansion for any of the BattleCON base sets.

Name: Le Monde en 100 Pays
Description:
This game makes you discover and know 100 countries. From your travels, you will bring back "Souvenirs" of the countries.
Goal of the game:

     Get the "Souvenir" cards from each country
     Be the richest at the end of the game by having the most cards possible "Souvenir" and capitalizing the most points possible

Name: Race for the Galaxy: New Worlds Promo Cards
Description:
Race for the Galaxy: New Worlds Promo is a set of 6 new start worlds for use with Race for the Galaxy.


     Star Nomad Raiders
     Industrial Robots
     Galactic Trade Emissaries
     Terraforming Colonists
     Abandoned Mine Squatters
     Gateway Station


These six new worlds can be added to the base game and any expansions, using the start rule from Rebel vs. Imperium:

Separate the start worlds by number into odd (red) and even (blue) groups. Shuffle and deal two start worlds, one from each group, to each player. Shuffle the remaining start worlds with the game cards and deal six to each player. Each player examines all eight cards (and any expansion goals in play) before discarding one of his two dealt start worlds and two of his six game cards. Players then reveal their start worlds and begin play.

Name: Mini Gangs
Description:
Mini Gangs is a post-apocalyptic miniatures skirmish rule set that combines ease of play with great strategic options resulting in a quick game with loads of depth. Its ideal for short club games, for playing a campaign and for getting beginners into tabletop battle games.

Mini Gangs can be played in three different ways, each appealing to a different level of gamer:

Gateway- A simple and easy game for beginners. Mini Gangs Gateway is designed to teach beginners how to play table top strategy games. It great for children of 6 years or older as the simple rules mean its easy to understand. It is also good for adults who have never played model based games before. It teaches all the core concepts that are used in more complex games.

Casual- A game for easy play and deep strategy. Mini Gangs Casual adds a deck of cards. These cards represent equipment, weapons and skills for your gang. This adds a layer of depth to the basic rules which makes it ideal for quick games. Whilst being simple, Casual makes for rewarding play. Mini Gangs Casual is great for club or gaming groups as it is a fast paced multi player game.

Hardcore- A sophisticated in-depth gaming experience. Mini Gangs Hardcore features a full points system, campaign rules and scenarios.

Name: Jogo!
Description: The goal of Jogo! is to get rid of as many cards as possible, and have the lowest score while utilizing various cards to skip, reverse, and perform various in game abilities.

Name: Caduta Libera
Description:
Answer correctly to all the question to increase your possibility to win as much money as possible. In this game, everytime someone is wrong, another one wins.

Every match is composed of 10 rounds: at the end of the round, an amount of money is assigned to the player who makes is opponent to fall down. The player with most money at the end of the game, will win.

Name: Caduta Libera Junior
Description:
Answer correctly to all the question to increase your possibility to win as much money as possible. In this game, everytime someone is wrong, another one wins.

Every match is composed of 10 rounds: at the end of the round, an amount of money is assigned to the player who makes is opponent to fall down. The player with most money at the end of the game, will win.

This version contains simplified questions for junior players.

Name: Jewels: Natale
Description:
Promo Card Natale for Jewels

In turn order every player look at the 3 top cards from the resource deck, he chooses one and put the other 2 at the end of the deck.

Name: Agricola: Rancher
Description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

Whenever, at the start of a round, you are using more farmyard spaces that any of the other players, you receive 1 Wood. (If there is a tie, you get nothing).

Name: Wir machen einen Krimi
Description:
Story telling game for children. With the help of 55 playing cards a story is created. The cards are all nicely illustrated and textless.

Every player gets six cards. With at least three cards he tells a story. If the story makes no sense he gets his cards back. If the story is fine he gets 2 points for a 3 card story, 3 points for a 4 card story, etc. After that the next player gets a turn.

When a player cannot make story he draws three more cards, if that does not help he loses his turn.

Already existing stories may be used in the telling of a new story. When there are no more cards and a player uses his last card the game ends. Who has the most points wins the game.

For small children or beginners it is advised to start with less cards in the stack.

—user summary

Name: Criminal Masterminds
Description:
Have you ever wanted to pull off the grand heists that you see in the movies? Well, here is your chance. Lead a crew to gather items required for the final heist. Partner up with fellow masterminds if you think you can trust them. Complete the final heist and win the loot…and the game!

Criminal Masterminds is a dice rolling game in which two to four players assume the roles of criminal masterminds attempting to pull off grand heists.

The Masterminds need to build a worthy crew who can assist them in acquiring the gear and vehicles required to pull of the final heist. They may team up with other masterminds and their crews to complete jobs or to attempt the final heist. But they always need to keep a close eye out to ensure that they can trust their fellow masterminds.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Order of Vampire Hunters: Peter Constant Expansion
Description:
An optional Kickstarter exclusive crossover character from the Lobotomy board game which comes with the following that can be used with the Order of Vampire Hunters game:

1 highly detailed plastic miniature
1 Hunter ID card
1 Basic Weapon card

Peter Constant has taken his battle against the monstrous creatures of the night outside the Lobotomy asylum!

Name: Russian Roulette
Description:
The Russian Roulette card game is a beer and pretzels game that contains all the thrills and excitement of the real game of chance without the potentially lethal risks.

The rules are very light and the games are fast. It’s a quick and portable game that can be played on the go. It’s great for downtime on game night, also while waiting at a restaurant, or standing in those long lines at your favorite conventions. The rules cover the basic 2 player game along with some variant rules. There are also advanced rules that add a scoring system which allow for more players and longer games.

Set includes 22 Cards of which there are two types of game cards and rules cards.

10 Empty Cylinder
10 Single Bullet
2 Rules

A Russian Roulette deck consists of 5 of each type of game card. This set has enough cards for two decks.

Card Specifics:
US Poker-Size 2.5” x 3.5” Printed on premium card stock, 11.8-pt. thickness, 305gsm black core card stock, Rounded-corners and Low-gloss UV Coating.

Name: Mycelium
Description:
A 2-player territorial game.

Materials
A hex board having 6 hexes to a side and a supply of White and Black stones

Setup
Each player has an allocated color (Black or White).

The board is initially empty. Using ABBAAB turn order. Black places a stone in an empty cell. Then White places two stones and then Black does the same; finally, White places the last stone in an empty cell.

Play
Black plays first.

Players take turns placing two stones on empty cells.

You cannot place a stone that forms a triangle of three adjacent friendly stones, and you must place next to a friendly stone.

Play continues until both players pass.

Scoring
An area of empty cells encircled by both colors, and/or including the edge, counts for the player with the most stones bordering it.

Areas encircled with an equal number of Black and White stones are not counted.

The player encircling the greater number of empty cells is the winner.

A special thanks to: Alain Curato, Christian Freeling, Joel Fox, Pablo Schulman, Russ Williams, for their invaluable help correcting my awful rules.

—description from the designer

Name: SpacePOP Galactic Glam Game
Description:
Get ready to turn up the music with the princesses of SpacePOP! Play as Athena, Hera, Rhea, Luna, or Juno as you race around the planets of the Pentangle, collecting all of the items to complete your ensemble before making your way back to the Space Bus.

Players pick one of the five princesses and must land on certain spaces to collect the four pieces of their outfits and single Space Pet. The first player to collect all five pieces and make it back to the Space Bus wins. Activity spaces require players to dance or sing to progress. Landing on Empress Geela's space sends you to her Dungeon of Doom and you must roll a specific number to get free.

This fashionably fun game features unique game play that will get everybody up and grooving, as well as glitter dice and transparent character cards.

Name: God's War
Description:
Let's pretend we have a time machine and go back to the time when the Elohim walked on Earth. We pretend to be one of Elyon's sons and to find ourselves in a vast territory that goes from Egypt to the Urartu chain, divided into thirty regions, one of which has been assigned to us as a legacy, together with the people who live there and few weapons he owns.

in God's War, everyone impersonates an Elohim who, starting from the initial territory assigned by Elyon, will have to earn the most Power Points by the end of the game, conquering peoples and new territories with their armies and appropriately dislocating the subjugated peoples in these territories. 
Moreover, each Elohim will be able to influence the course of the game using wisely and cunningly the weapons he will find in the arsenal and the Miracles he will be able to obtain.

Name: Pickett's Charge: The Last Attack at Gettysburg July 3, 1863
Description:
Easily the most famous engagement of the Civil War, Pickett’s Charge was the high-water mark of the Confederacy. A frontal attack across open ground by 12,000 - 15,000 men against the center of the Union line in the teeth of withering artillery and infantry fire, Pickett’s Charge was the defining moment of the battle of Gettysburg and, although militarily futile, represents to many the courage and glory of the Confederate soldier.

Pickett’s Charge: The Last Attack at Gettysburg July 3, 1863 is a beer-and-pretzel, solitaire simulation at the brigade level of the historical events of July 3, 1863.  The Player commands the Confederate side while the Union side follows solitaire rules. Besides the historical scenario, there are four other scenarios: Effective Confederate Bombardment, Culp's Hill Coordinated Attack, Additional Infantry Support, and J.E.B. Stuart's Cavalry.

—description from the publisher

Name: Crossing Olympus
Description:
Fed up with the foolishness of mortals, the Gods of Olympus have gathered to debate the fate of mankind...

An exciting, strategic 2 player game puts the power of the 12 Olympian Gods in your hands!

NOW AVAILABLE ON TABLE TOP SIMULATOR: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2629187044

Take control of the 12 Olympian Gods and Goddesses and use the powers of Zeus, Hera, Apollo, Poseidon, Hermes, Artemis, Athena, Dionysus, Ares, Aphrodite, Hephaestus, and Hades. Each brings a unique ability that can alter the fate of your competition.

Who will be the first to cross Mount Olympus?

HOW TO PLAY

Each player is provided 12 Gods of Olympus cards, light and dark.

The gods and goddesses have individualized health points, movements, attacks and special abilities that match their characteristics, to deeply tie theme in with mechanics.

The game is played on a 9x9 diagonal board. The first space on both sides are the "gates" spaces. It will be your goal to either eliminate all the other player's characters, or move any of your characters onto your opponent's gate space.

On your first turn, select a character to "summon" onto your gates space. On subsequent turns, you will choose to move, attack, or bring additional characters into play.

All of the cards are balanced so that they are equal in power. Zeus has twice as much health as Hermes, Hermes has far more mobility and provides a "Winged Sandals" ability that increases the movement of other pieces. Athena has even less health, but a powerful "Aegis Shield" ability protects other pieces. All characters will be equally important to achieving your victory.

Expansions will add deck building and asymmetric gameplay options.

Try playing chess with each of the 12 Greek Gods as your pieces.

Name: Agricola: Guildmaster
Description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

You receive 4 Wood when you acquire the Joinery or play the Cabinetmaker. When you acquire the Pottery or play the Potter, you receive 4 Clay. When you acquire the Basketmaker's Workshop or play the Basketmaker, you receive 3 Reed. If you have already played any of these cards when you play the Guildmaster, you receive 2 building resource of the appropriate type for each existing card.

Name: Agricola: Pelts
Description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

For each animal that you slaughter and return to the general supply, you may place 1 Food from your personal supply in 1 of your rooms. You may have a maximum of 1 Food in each room. You cannot use these Food any more, but each is worth 1 Bonus point at the end of the game.

Name: Agricola: Feed pellets
Description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

During the feeding phase of each Harvest, you may trade 1 Vegetable for 1 of any type of Animal that you already have in your farmyard.

Name: Agricola: Clay deposit
Description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

This card is an additional Action space. A player who uses this action must pay you 1 Food and receives 5 Clay. If you use the Clay Deposit yourself, you may choose to take 2 bonus points instead of the Clay.

Name: Agricola: Animal trainer
Description:
Promo card on Lookout spiel website

Whenever you take food from a Travelling Players space, you may immediately use it to buy animals: Pay 2 food for each Sheep or Wild Boar and 3 Food for each Cattle.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Hamburg
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Krefeld
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Unlabeled: The Blind Beer Tasting Game
Description:
The game is simple! Each player brings one or two beers to the game, keeping their identities hidden. Unlabeled is played one round at a time. Each round, a small portion of “unlabeled” beer is served. Players taste the beer and ATTEMPT TO IDENTIFY THE BEER’S CHARACTERISTICS, GENERAL BEER CATEGORY, OR SPECIFIC BEER TYPE. The label is revealed and points are awarded. Next round!

Points are awarded based on your accuracy to identify the “unlabeled” beer… Earn 1 point for identifying a simple beer characteristic (ALE OR LAGER?). Earn 2 points for identifying the beer’s general category (PORTER OR STOUT?). Earn 3 points for identifying the specific beer type (OATMEAL STOUT OR IRISH STOUT?). Earn maximum points for identifying the EXACT NAME AND BREWERY. Careful! Push your luck too far and you could score zero!

Name: Museum: The Black Market
Description:
Away from prying eyes…

Museum is about the wonders of the archaeological world, the light, the colour, the textures of these wonders of history put on display for all to see!

What some don’t realise though is that there was a dark underworld that shadowed it. Welcome, ladies and gentlemen, to the Black Market, where anything is obtainable…if you can pay the price.

Black Market is the fourth expansion for Museum and adds a market system to the game where you may purchase Objects and Notoriety cards to complete your collections and harass your adversaries. For those of you looking to put a more aggressive emphasis on the interaction between players in Museum, this is the one for you!


     Objects:


The 30 object cards featured in the expansion are all from civilisations outside of the ones present in the base game. You’ll know them by their rather unique appearance (Images coming shortly) and the fact that they only have one attribute! For example, there’s the Viking Longship that will only sport a Navigation Icon or maybe the Terracotta army, the famous guardians of emperor Qin Shi Huang which only counts as a Chinese card? These and many more are purchased exactly like any other object and can give your collections a much needed boost!


     Notoriety Cards:


Museum has always had a pleasant level of player interaction, with each player concentrating on building up their Museum. With these new cards though, you can throw many a wrench in your opponent’s plans! Purchased like an object card, they follow exactly the same rules as a standard notoriety card except their effects are much more aggressive. Steal objects, create counterfeits, and steal prestige right out from underneath your opponent’s noses! The ends justifies the means!

All these new cards will be available on a separate market board . When cards first appear, they’ll cost more but as they stick around for longer, their cost will go down. So, do you shell out right from the start or wait for a better price at the risk of having them stolen out from you?

The Black Market expansion includes 60 new Contraband cards (objects and Notoriety cards) as well as new characters, events and Notoriety cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Museum: The People's Choice
Description:
The People have spoken...

What would a Museum be without the people that visit it? How would all these treasures shine if not through the eyes of all those that behold them? A Museum lives, and dies, by the will of the public.

In this expansion, you and your friends can battle it out for public acclaim as well adding a 5th player to your games of Museum!

In The People’s Choice, you’ll be competing for a common objective that is drawn at the beginning of the game. For example: The “B.C.” card awards players with the most BC dated cards in their museum. The player with the most cards takes the People’s Choice token and keeps it until another player amasses a bigger collection.

At the end of the game the player with the token earns bonus points! There are 10 different People’s Choice cards, each one with different criteria: Date, value, regions and themes!

Additionally, by public demand, this expansion also includes the necessary material to play Museum with up to 5 players! This includes a Museum board and tokens for the base game, as well as all the elements necessary to play each of the expansions with up to 5 players. Also, for the Kickstarter version we’ll be including an additional KS exclusive Discard tile.

—description from the publisher

Name: Experiment on Dinosaur Island (fan expansion for Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island)
Description:
New scenario for Robinson Crusoe

Trapped in the Visitor's Center while a storm rages and dinosaurs roam free, you have 10 rounds to drain fuel from different parts of the island to restore power to the electric fence while battling off an onslaught of increasingly dangerous predators. If you feel bold, you can also try to snag some dinosaur DNA samples for your own profit.
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: "The Naturalist" Scenario (fan expansion for Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island)
Description:
New scenario for Robinson Crusoe

Scenario Overview:
You have been assigned to the crew of the scout ship HMS Beagle and will participate in the famous 1831 survey voyage of discovery. Help the ship’s naturalist, Charles Darwin, catalog the diverse flora and fauna of the cursed island, by gathering as many wildlife specimens as possible. Your ship has departed to restock provisions on the mainland and will return at the end of the 12th round to transport you and your findings home. Gather what you can and survive to tell your tale.
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: Tanks: Crusader Tank Expansion
Description:
The highly mobile Crusader tank was a mainstay of the British forces during the North African campaign. The high speed allowed the tank to fire on the move and strike at the weaker side armor of the German tanks, however when caught out in the open it could be easy prey for the heavier enemy tanks.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Crusader tank
1x Crusader tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew card
2x Upgrade cards

Name: Angry Birds: Green Bird Add-On, 3-Pack
Description:
It's an Angry Birds Expansion Pack and only playable with Mattel Angry Birds board games.

You can continue the fun of building, launching and destroying with this Angry Birds Add-On pack! It comes with three figures and six special power cards to add new specific functions for each bird, increase difficulty and enhance gameplay.

This set includes these figures: Green Bird, Blue Bird, and Construction Hat Pig.

The Angry Birds game will be set up as usual, except that the new power cards are shuffled in a different pile.
Every player draws a power card at the start of the turn. Every power card is different. Some of them adds a bonus pig to the castle, some other just swaps the first bird to a new one, but even special attacks can be executed.
With Green bird you can shoot again from the place it landed, with Blue bird you can shoot 3 times, etc.

Name: Flamme Rouge: Plateaux de Wallonie
Description:
New stage card given out as a promotional item at Spiel '17 by Lautapelit.fi and offered by Gigamic at conventions.

The card depicts the setup for a new track that can be played in Flamme Rouge.

Name: Miś Wojtek
Description:
MiÅ› Wojtek — "Wojtek the Bear" in English — is a family board game with a rich historical background, telling the story of Poland's "soldier bear" Wojtek (pronounced like "VOY-tek") who shared the complicated fate of Poles deported from Poland deep into Russia during World War II.

In September 1939, Poland was attacked by its neighbors: Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union. Poland was conquered and divided between the invaders. Many Poles were expelled and sent to forced labor camps or sent to remote areas of the Soviet Union. Then, in a surprise move in 1941, the German army invaded the USSR. Joseph Stalin, the leader of the USSR, agreed to create an army from the Polish soldiers who had been held in Soviet camps. Following the deterioration of Polish-Soviet relations in March 1942, these Polish soldiers and civilians left the USSR under the command of General Anders to support British allies in the fight against Germany.

On their way from the Soviet Union to Iran, Polish soldiers bought a small, malnourished bear from a hungry Persian boy. They named the bear "Wojtek" and enlisted him in the army, complete with military papers and the rank of private.

Wojtek remained with the soldiers throughout their difficult journey from Iran, through Palestine, Egypt, and Italy to Scotland. He shared their ups and downs, their joys and sorrows, giving them many opportunities to smile and helping them when in need. He guarded the equipment, and during the battle of Monte Cassino, he even carried heavy ammunition boxes.

The players join Wojtek the bear and the Polish II Corps on their journey from the USSR to Edinburgh, Scotland. Along the way, they collect souvenirs related to the fate of General Anders's soldiers and their famous bear. The aim of the game is to collect the best set of memorabilia!

At the beginning of the game, players receive five travel cards and a bear pawn. Players take turns in clockwise order. On a turn, the active player plays a travel card with a truck and moves their pawn to the next (closest) empty space in the color of the card played. Then the player takes one bear card from the board, from the box with the same color as the color of the space to which their pawn moved. Finally, the player refills their travel card hand up to five cards, and ends their turn.

To move their pawn, the players may also play wild cards with a walking bear (which allows them to move to a space of any color as long as they don't pass another pawn) or play three travel cards in the same color in order to name any color and move to the next (closest) empty space in the chosen color.

At the moment when the first pawn reaches Edinburgh or any player has a complete set of bear cards (six different cards of the same type), the last round of the game begins.

After ending the last round, players score their bear cards. Players sort their cards into sets. Each set must have the same type of cards, with no repeated cards. The largest possible set is a complete set of six different cards in one color. The player with the largest set wins.

A note on language dependency: The game is almost fully bilingual: Some components (city cards, game board) are double-sided, with English on one side and Polish on the other side. Other game elements are language independent. Both English and Polish rulebooks are provided in the box.

Name: Paparazzoo
Description:
“Have you ever tried to lead a group of tourists through a crowded zoo while being chased by a giant gorilla?”

In real life, this might be a little too exciting, but in Paparazzoo it’s the scene of a tactical and interactive board game. In Paparazzoo, 3-5 competitive tour guides lead strings of tourists through a zoo – the central game board. The tourists strive to photograph as many animals as they can, while being hindered by a gorilla on the loose. Players draft action cards to move or expand their group, take pictures or direct the gorilla to the rival guides! The player to best guide the tourists’ movements, while staying out of the gorillas way, wins the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Stoopido
Description:
For setup each player gets a big red pair of plastic glasses on which different parts of masks can be attached: one part for the hat (or top of the head), one for the nose, two for the ears, and one for the eyes (some of the later also hinder sight).

Player take turns to roll a six sided custom die with faces, which determine, which part can be added to a face. Then everybody tries to first hit the correct "button" tile in front of the players, to be allowed to place such a part onto another player. Additionally there is a "wild" die face, which allows to place any part and a "bad luck" one, were another player may put a part onto the player, who rolled the die.

Whoever is first full attached with all pieces looses the game and a photography can be taken from him or her.

Name: Pioneers: Queenie 2 – The Specialists
Description:
The Specialists is a mini-expansion for Pioneers that contains 18 specialist tiles. Before starting the game, you replace a number of pioneer tiles with specialist tiles, then carry out the normal set-up of the tiles on the board.

Specialists work like pioneers but are better: the banker specialist lets you take 3 dollars, the merchant specialist lets you take an action already taken this turn, the sergeant specialist lets you replace a road, the barkeeper specialist lets you replace one of your pioneers, the gold digger specialist lets you discard a gold nugget for dollars, and the farmer specialist lets you place an extra farmer on a stagecoach still containing a farmer.

Name: Warlords: Dragon Expansion
Description:
The Dragon Expansion is the second add-on to the Warlords game. It can be used with any number of players.

When the first player "goes out", the round continues with that player using the Dragon between each other player's turns, the round ending when a second player goes out.

Fireball dice are placed on the Dragon’s back, between the wings. Dice are flicked off the Dragon’s back from this position in the center ring.

Name: Pioneers: Queenie 3 – The Farmers
Description: The Farmers is a mini-expansion for Pioneers that contains one special coach which has space for two farmers and is worth 4 VP.

Name: Noir
Description:
Noir is a ‘denouement’ game for 3 – 6 Detectives that lasts only a few minutes per round. The ‘denouement mechanic’ is a special type of storytelling game, where the key elements of the stories events are determined by the game, then the players must weave them together in the most inventive of ways. 
In Noir the game’s Judge sets a Victim and a Killer. Then players must select a Means, Motive and Opportunity from cards in their hand. They then use these elements to tell the story of how the killer did the deed. Preferably this is delivered in the style of a Detective in the third act, revealing to the audience and assembled cast just how clever they were to figure it out. The stories are cross examined and picked for holes by the other players, before the Judge settles on the best, using whatever criteria they prefer.
Noir is packed with a grim cast of Femme Fatales, gum shoe P.I.s, mean Mobsters and hardened Hit Men. The play throws up stories which are by turns dark, hilarious, inventive and always, always memorable. 
At the bitter end the best denouement of the game wins!

Name: Ghost Hunter: Angels & Demons
Description:
Angels and Demons is the 5th deck to be added to the Ghost Hunter cannon. In this card game you must compete to capture the angelic and the diabolical a like.

The cards feature gothic art of angels and daemons from holy lore as voted for by the backers. This theme is replicated in the special rules which sees each Angel matched with an opposing Demon.  You as a Ghost Hunter must choose which to specialize in capturing, for the best bonuses in your final score.

Ghost Hunter: Angels & Demons is a card game for 2 – 6 players that should last between 10-30 minutes. Players take it in turns to lay higher and higher cards on a central stack. If a player can’t lay an equal or higher card on the stack then they have to pick it up. If a player manages to lay a group of 3 cards at once then they get to capture the stack. Plenty of the cards come with special rules that you can manipulate to turn the game your way. The first player to play all of their cards ends the game and then players count up the scores of all of the cards that they captured minus all of the cards that they didn’t manage to get rid of. The player with the highest score wins the game.

The rules are simple but the strategies can be complex. Skill and luck play their parts in equal measure in this short but engaging card game. It pays to get rid of your cards and be the Ghost Hunter who ends the game but victory is never assured until the final scores are counted.

It is a standalone game but can be combined with the other Ghost Hunter decks for variation.

—description from the designer

Name: Wrasslefest XXVI
Description:
WRASSLEFEST XXVI is a wild party game where players get a theme and ten minutes to come up with a pro wrestling persona. The audience then decides who's got the coolest Intro, the best Smack Talk, and the wildest Signature Move. It can be played with just 3 people, though of course you can have as many as you want for total mayhem!

The game comes with rules for standard play, as well as Bonus Modes like Tag Team Tournaments and Legacy Mode.

-description from the designer

Name: Tiny Swords
Description:
Tiny Swords is a cute, casual card game about fast fun duels with customizable swords that can fit in your wallet. Each themed set comes with its own unique cards, including a charm card that can dramatically change how the game is played.

A complete game for two players can be made by printing out just one sheet of 8.5x11 paper, but the extra expansions add all kinds of fun new card themes to play with!

Included is a Tiny Swords instruction manual you can either read as a PDF or print out as a minizine!

—description from the designer

The print-and-play game is distributed as an instruction manual and several print-and-play card packs, including:


        Wave I - Spooky, Sweet, Mermaid, Moon
        Wave II - Puppy, Kitty, Cafe, Forest
        Wave III - Circus, Clockwork, Dino, Lucky


"Spooky/Sweet" and "Mermaid/Moon" are considered the traditional "starter" packs.

The game was released as a free "beta" version in 2016; following a successful Kickstarter a commercial "print and play" version was released in 2017.

Game play involves hand management of custom cards that represent a player's "tiny sword" - a "parry" card, a "slice" card, and a "thrust" card.  Each card type beats one other card type but in turn is beaten by the other card type in a traditional "rock-paper-scissors" paradigm.  Players alternate turns attacking an opponent of their choice; selected card pairs are simultaneously revealed and resolved by card swapping and possible card elimination.  In addition, some cards have special powers that may be activated during resolution.  In the case of "ties", resolution may require succeeding card plays.  Players who have all their sword cards eliminated are themselves eliminated from the game.  Play continues with fewer players until only one player remains holding one or more sword cards.

—user summary

Name: Rondella
Description: The pawns have to move from the middle of the board into the round-about. Movement is determined by a die. The round-about is placed at the end of any one of the four lanes, but can be moved to any other lane by a player rolling a 1. Thus the situation keeps changing. The first player who gets all his 4 pawns into the round-about wins the game.

Name: Starseer
Description:
Starseer is a short, quiet, co-operative card game for 2 players.

Conduct the ritual, listen to the stars.

—description from the designer

Play requires 2 players but can accommodate more.  The game does not specify age ranges or play times, but the process is fairly abstract (not for very young children).

The game takes place over three turns.  During each turn, one player assumes the role of "Eye" and all other players assume the role of "Hand(s)".  The "Eye" draws a "Constellation" card which becomes the object of the cooperative game; the "Constellation" is not shown to the "Hand(s)".

Using various hand gestures and playing various "Star" cards, the "Eye" attempts to guide the "Hand(s)" into correctly guessing which "Constellation" card is in play.  The game does not allow verbal or written communication.  Play is entirely cooperative, if abstract, and proceeds until the "Hand(s)" correctly guess the "Constellation", whereupon play passes to the next player who assumes the role of "Eye".  All players win the game after three "Constellations" have been successfully resolved.

—user summary

Name: YAKS: The Acronym Game!
Description:
YAKS - The Acronym Game! is a party game where random letters become acronyms for whatever you care to create.

Each player has sixty seconds to form a phrase, name, or fictional organization from the 4 letters rolled our YAKS scientifically engineered dice.

Whoever's submission is the funniest will win an adorable miniature Yak. When all the Yaks have been handed out the player with the most wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Battle In: The Dungeon
Description:
Memorize your spellbook or strap on your longsword - it's time to Battle In: The Dungeon!

Grab up to three friends (or play solo!), pick a hero and jump into the fray.  Enter a room, battle monsters of all types - skeletons, goblins and bears, oh my! (and dozens more) - and leverage your hero's skills to survive.  Loot your foes and move on to the next room.  If you can make it through seven rooms you're pretty good; if you can make it through ten rooms you can call yourself an epic hero, worthy of bards tales from here until the end of time.  But be warned - sometimes the best laid plans fall apart once you set foot in the dungeon.

The mechanics of the game are easy.  Flip over a room card which gives you bonuses/penalties/adjustments.  Deal out monster cards (the same number as the number of heroes who entered the dungeon).  Order them by their Initiative score.  Then fight.

Fighting is dead simple - if you can do basic math you can play.  Take your hero's attack value, roll a 20-sided die (included) and add them together.  Subtract the monster's defense value and if what's left is more than 10 it's a hit.  Subtract your hero's damage from the monster's hit points (represented by cubes) then move to the next hero or monster in line.  Once you get to the end you start again until either all the heroes or all the monsters are defeated.

But don't let that fool you - this isn't a "beat level 1 monsters, then move to level 2" kind of dungeon.  Sure, you might find a lowly kobold in the first room, but you might also find a brown bear.  Or a zombie.  Or a dragon.  Because let's face it - knowing what you're going to find is just plain boring.  And there's nothing boring when when there's a Battle In: The Dungeon.

Name: Zodiac Attack
Description:
Author's description

Two-player arcade dogfighting for your table! Every turn your bullets move in the direction they're fired. Zip around the map, fire your bullets and be the last animal standing.

User summary

The game is played on a large grid play surface with boundary edges.  Players alternate turns.  During a player's turn they move their token and may fire a projectile (each projectile is fired in one of eight directions).  After each player moves and fires, all projectiles move one square in the direction of their invariable travel.  Projectiles that move into an occupied square "hit" the object in the square and become expended.  Player tokens that are thus hit incur damage.  Note that projectiles do not "belong" to one player or another, and it is possible for players to "shoot themselves".

The goal of the game is to remain alive longer than your opponent.  The first player destroyed loses; the other player wins.

Anything that "moves off" the right side of the play surface reappears on the left side of the play surface; anything that "moves off" the top of the play surface reappears on the bottom of the play surface, etc., in a mode common to many old video arcade games.  Thus, as turns progress the grid becomes increasingly encumbered with projectiles (insuring that impacts occur increasingly frequently).

Name: Nerd Fest: The Comic Convention Game
Description:
Nerd Fest is a humorous dice and card game for 2-4 players. It takes about 10 minutes to learn and 30 minutes to play. Ages 7 and up. The game contains 12 Character Cards, 54 Luck Cards, 64 Swag Cards, 1 Convention Center Card, 2 dice & 4 colored game tokens in a full color box.

To start the game each player chooses a Character Card. The characters are based on the classic types that you find at a comic convention.

Each character has an amount of Swag Cards they need to collect.

On each turn, players choose a part of the con to visit and then based on a dice roll, they can collect Swag Cards.

To mix things up, players have a hand of Luck Cards.  You play your Luck Cards to take extra turns, get bonus rolls and other effects.

The first player to collect the correct amount of Swag Cards wins the game!

Name: Stargammon
Description: Three player backgammon on triangular board.

Name: Stalingrad
Description:
The pivotal battle for the Soviets in WW2. After this battle the Germans would never again go on the offensive on the eastern front. Now you take the generals seat and try to do better than the historical outcome.

—description from the back of the box

Stalingrad is a low priced 2 player strategy board game covering the epic battle between the German and Societ forces in and around the city of Stalingrad during WWII.

On June 22, 1941, Germany and the Axis powers invaded the Soviet Union, quickly advancing deep into Soviet territory. The fighting in 41 culminated in a fierce Soviet counter attack on the outskirts of Moscow, which saved the city. Entering 42 Hitler and his commanders shifted the offensive south towards Stalingrad, breaking through the Soviet lines and threatening to cut off the oil rich Caucuses from the main soviet industrial areas. Stalingrad was the lynch pin to the defense of the Soviet south and the place Stalin had demanded the Russian people make a stand at all costs. The result was the bloodiest battle of WWII.

In Stalingrad the game begins with the German drive on Stalingrad itself. Both players begin the game getting a fixed assortment of troop reinforcements, which later shifts to troop purchases as decided by the players. The battle consists of fighting up to and around Stalingrad and includes the northern Caucasus region, plus fighting inside the city itself on the more detailed city map.

-description from GoB website

Part of the Compact Game Series
SKU GUI8030
Boxed, 4.5" x 5.75" x 1.5" game box

Difficulty Level: Easy

The box contains:
1 10"x15" full color map
1 11"x17" full color map in 2 pieces
1 D10 die
Rules
136 full color die cut units
Families: Series: Compact Game Series (Guild of Blades)

Name: Kikori
Description:
Kikori is Japanese for a lumberjack and is an area control game for two players.

Materials
7x7 board and 49 double-sided tiles

Play
One player plays with the yellow tree tiles the other player with the red tree tiles. The Kikori tile is placed in the center space of the board and is the only tile on the board at the start. Players take turns performing one of two actions.


     Place two tree tiles on diagonally or orthogonally adjacent empty spaces (Player One on his first turn only places one tree)or 
     Place one tree tile on an empty space and move the Kikori to an empty space adjacent to the tree tile last placed and adjacent to at least one of your opponent’s trees. Next flip over one of your opponents' tree tiles that is adjacent to the Kikori. Flipped tiles become neutral for the rest of the game.


The game ends when a player is unable to take his turn.

End Game
The player with the largest group of trees diagonally and/or orthogonally connected is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Prinzessin Mix-Max
Description:
In Prinzessin Mix-Max, the four princesses want to have a birthday party. They have arranged to meet in the castle garden for a picnic, but somehow things have gotten mixed up. Before the celebration can begin, Charlie the little dog needs to search in the garden for the princesses and everything they need for their party. Who will be able to put together the nine pieces of a complete princess puzzle first?


     roll the die
     move Charlie
     collect pieces for your princess puzzle

Name: Spin it!
Description:
Let’s go on a thrilling ride in Spin it! The spring fair is underway in the city, and everyone's standing in line for the wildest ride of all. The cars fly about so quickly that the animals dare to ride it only with their very best friends. Who will be the first to get all their animals on the crazy car ride?

In more detail, spin the arrow on the disc, lay a card next to a matching animal, use the action symbols, and play all of your cards to win.

Name: Resort Buggy
Description:
One beautiful resort, two to four players all with different agendas but all sharing the love of the ‘Resort Buggy’ ride.
A game of chance, strategy and competition where each player has different criteria to win. Be a resort guest, resort manager, conservationist or developer and take the ‘Resort Buggy’ ride to fun.
Will the resort be saved, become a large tourist development or will it become a world heritage site? You determine!
OBJECT OF THE GAME:
Race to fulfil the ‘To Win’ requirements for your team. The first player to do so wins the game.
Blue Player- The Resort Guest (RG) team wants to have an amazing holiday and check off all the bucket list of activities during the holiday stay.
Yellow Player- The Resort Manager (RM) team wants to retain the resort as a successful operation by receiving favourable internet blogs, sighting endangered species to attract tourists and ensuring villas are cleaned. (For the 2 and 3 player game variations – Resort Manager also striving to acquire businesses in the resort).
Green Player - The Conservationist (CV) team wants to sight endangered species, lodge a conservation order and obtain sufficient petitions.
Red Player - The Developer (DV) team wants to acquire businesses in the resort, conceal any endangered species sighted, lodge a development application, pay required legal fees and create a blog on the proposed development.

GAME THEME - Resort

GAME MECHANICS - move to relevant areas on board via dice roll, card selection

TO WIN CRITERIA (in detail)
Resort Guest:
-    For a 2 player game – stay for a minimum of 2 weeks
-    For a 3 & 4 player game – stay for a minimum of 1 week
-    Go on a Resort Activity
-    Go out for dinner at the Savoury Swan Restaurant
-    Have a day spa treatment at Heaven’s Day Spa
-    Make a purchase at Gratitude’s Gift Shop
-    Make a blog at the Internet Kiosk rating the resort 
        amenities/laundry
-    Sight 1 endangered species twice
-    Go on Conservation Eco Walk
-    Go on Conservation Canoe
-    Go on Conservation Night Adventure Tour
Resort Manager:
-    Be at the top of the Resort Manager Counter Path
-    Sight 2 endangered species twice
-    Place 8 Villa Clean counters on villas.  Can only clean 
        a villa once
-    For 2 & 3 player game only – acquire at least 2 
        businesses (Day Spa, Restaurant, Gift Shop)
Conservationist:
-    Sight 3 endangered species twice
-    Place 8 Petition counters on villas.  Only 1 petition 
        counter per villa. (additional petitions are to be 
        collected based on Resort Manager Counter position.  
        Additional online petitions are obtained via the 
        Internet Kiosk or by favourable Resort Daily cards.)  
-    Lodge a Conservation Order in the Internet Kiosk. Fee 
        10RD$
Developer:
-    Be at the top of the Developer Counter Path
-    Acquire at least 2 businesses (Day Spa, Restaurant, Gift 
        Shop)
-    Lodge Development Application in Internet Kiosk.  Fee 
        6RD$
-    Pay any legal fees as determined by Resort Manager 
        Counter position
-    Make a blog on proposed development at the Internet 
        Kiosk

Name: Science Ninjas: Valence Plus
Description:
Valence Plus is a fun card game that uses simple math, colors, and cartoon ninjas to teach kids (8+) chemistry! Players combine more than 12 different elements to interact with each other and win the game! Valence Plus expands on the elements and chemical reactions players can make from the original Valence game.

Players draw Element cards from the deck in order to form Molecules. Each Element has a different Valence number that describes how many electrons it has to give (positive) or how many electrons it needs (negative) to have a full valence shell. If the Valence numbers add up to zero, they form a Molecule!

Each Molecule is worth a certain point value. If your molecules add up to 16 points then you win the game! But beware… several molecules are vulnerable to attack from your opponents! Acids attack Bases (4 points) and turn them into Salt and Water (1 point each). Deadly Carbonyls (which have the special power of removing oxygen from the board) are vulnerable to attack by Water. Players interact with each other using real chemical reactions!

Name: Meine ersten Spiele: Würfelwürmchen
Description:
Look! There's something glowing! Caterpillar Carlo stretches upright and discovers Firefly Fiola landing a few leaves ahead of him on the leaf path. He would so love to play with her. Do you have enough good luck to get the little caterpillar to his firefly friend before Fiola reaches the end of the path and flies away?

Würfelwürmchen includes three little games for 1 to 3 children ages 2 and older.

Name: Meine ersten Spiele: Feuerwehr
Description:
So far, it has been a quiet day at the fire department in Habatown. Suddenly, the big siren at the fire station roars to life. There's a fire in the city! Firefighters Max and Anton are ready in a flash, jumping into the bright red fire engine and racing off to fight the fire. With their siren wailing and equipped with hose, bucket and fire extinguisher, they know just what to do!

Who knows where the equipment can be found in the fire engine in Feuerwehr to quickly put out the fire?

Name: Abenteuer 1x1
Description:
Deep in the impenetrable rainforest lies a legendary city of gold. Many fortune hunters have ventured forth to capture the city's unfathomable riches hidden in the high towers, yet none of them succeeded, having been forced to turn back empty-handed.

In Abenteuer 1x1, your expedition has come closer than any other! Only one more hurdle lies between you and your goal: a massive mosaic portal, covered in numerical riddles bars the entrance to the city. Only when you can solve the riddles with the help of multiplication tables, rearranging as many mosaic tiles as possible, will the portal swing open and the treasure be yours!

Name: Banker of the Gods
Description:
Banker of the Gods is a game about superstitious civilizations competing on a friendly stock-market set in an ancient Japanese-inspired world. It has a unique stock-market mechanism that allows for deduction of market trends before you invest for the next round. There are over a million different kinds of markets to be generated. The market may booming during this game, and other games you will have a depression to survive or thrive in.

A medium-weight worker placement game for 1-5 players. In this alternate universe China, Egypt, Greece, and Rome have been attracted to a lucrative stock-market on Oki island in ancient Japan. Besides stocks you may also try to succeed at having other players honor your Gods and harnessing their powers, or by dabbling with products like Sake (linked to the price of rice), or helping islanders by giving them home-loans for the best locations, or even trying your luck with tea-leaves at the Geisha house, among other things. All illustrated in a colorful Japanese wood-block art style.

Traditionally stock market games have unfriendly take-that, Banker of the Gods doesn't. 
vMaster the ancient art of banking to become the Banker of the Gods.

Name: Fahrt frei zum Grand Prix
Description: There is no game board. The racetrack is variable and has to be assembled from several track segments. The movement of the race cars is determined by two dice. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first plyer to reach the finish line or completes an agreed upon number of laps wins the game.

Name: What Do You Meme?: Stoner Expansion Pack
Description:
Perfect images and captions that embody the "Stoner" culture.

Includes 65 Cards (50 Caption cards & 15 Photo cards) to be added to core game.

Add the cards to their respective decks and play as normal.

Name: Tavern Masters: Over 21 Promo Pack
Description:
A pack of 22 promotional cards created from the Kickstarter stretch goals.

Shuffle the cards into the respective decks and proceed as normal

Name: Petropoli
Description: Petropoli is a game oriented to the simulation of the global oil market, with the production of crude oil, whose price fluctuates according to various factors, sales to importing countries and the possibility of diversifying investments by focusing on renewable energy. All of this, obviously, aimed at achieving the greatest possible profit.

Name: Aussie Scrabble
Description:
In a world-first for Scrabble, Mattel has today launched the first country-specific version of the game – Aussie Scrabble. The new edition celebrates Australia’s quirky deviations from the English language, adding homegrown flavour with an all-Aussie slang glossary featuring our localised lingo. Mattel took to social media with its mate Jetstar in 2016 to crowd source the best slang words from across the country for potential inclusion into the final glossary. More than 20,000 submissions via the Jetstar Facebook page were put forward, with words such as ‘arvo’, ‘crikey’, ‘biffo’, ‘shonky’ and ‘cozzie’ forming the official word glossary.

A fair-dinkum twist on the classic word game, Aussie Scrabble seperates the legends from the drongos with new gameplay and a Lingo List, native to the land down under. Gather your mates together and give it a burl!

Name: Clue Jr.: Spongebob Squarepants Edition – The Case of the Missing Jellyfish Net
Description:
On a player's turn they will roll the die. If the die shows blue, that player secretly looks under any blue character pawn; yellow, that player secretly looks under any yellow item pawn; a number, that player moves any character pawn that number of spaces around the game board and then follows the instructions as indicated on the space the pawn ends its movement on.

On the bottom the blue bases is a sticker of a case for the net or a time. On the bottom of one of the yellow bases is a sticker of the net, the rest depict an X.

When you look at the bottom of a base, mark on your detective sheet the knowledge you gained.

The object of the game is to determine who stole the net (the character whose base has the case for the net), at what time of day (the only time that won't be crossed off), and where they left it (the item whose base had the sticker for the net).

At the end of your turn, if you can correctly answer the above questions, you win!

—user summary
Families: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)
Game: Cluedo Junior / Clue Junior (Parker Brothers, et al)

Name: Big Bluff Quiz
Description:
Big Bluff Quiz, a.k.a., BBQ, is a question game in which you can win even if you don't know any of the answers! You may pretend you know them, be self confident, and end up a little lucky. Do not push your luck either as BBQ may "grill" you.

To set up, place fifteen tokens numbered 2-16 in the middle of the playing area. One of the players takes a card and reads the question. All players may then take one of the numbered tokens, which represents both their bet and the number of answers they think they know. If the question asked you to name the planets in the solar system, for example, a player who took the #5 token is saying that they know five planets and are betting 5 points. One of the players is then chosen to give their answers. They win their bet if they succeed and lose it if they fail. The other players win their bets even if they didn't know any of the answers!

Name: Safari Golo
Description:
In Safari Golo, players compete to be the first to see six different types of land animals, but to do so they need to hop from island to island while trying to remember where everything is that they've already seen.

The game includes fifty tiles: six each of six different land animals, two whales, and three each of four other sea animals. Shuffle these tiles face down, then place five (still face down) around each of thee ten islands while the players start on the central, eleventh island. On a turn, a player first looks at any face-down tile on the board, then moves to any island adjacent to their current location except the one where they just looked at a tile, then they draw and reveal a tile from the island where they just arrived. If the tile shows a land animal, they keep it. (Exception: A player cannot have three tiles of the same type. If they would take one, they instead place it on any empty location on the game board.) If the tile shows a sea animal, they take the special action associated with that animal, then discard the tile.

If you arrive on an island with another player and that player has a duplicate animal that you don't already have, you can give them an animal tile of your choice to take one of the duplicated animals.

Collect six different types of land animals first, and you win! If multiple players complete their sextet the same round, then the player with the most overall animals wins.

Name: Project ·G·A·M·E·
Description:
This game was developed for and given out to participants of the geocaching mega event "Project ·G·A·M·E·" in Bremen(Germany), on May 31st 2009.

The board is printed on DIN A3 photo paper. The rules are similar to "Snakes & Ladders" with some minor twists.

     No dice is used. Instead, participants of the event recieved a "geocoin", which also could be used as a dice, with a spinning pointer.
     Blue Symbols on the map allow the player to move forward.
     Red Symbols on the map send the player backwards.
     Green symbols allow the player to decide if s/he wants to go forward or backward.
     A cog symbol lets you spin the counter/roll the dice a second time.
     A magnet symbol lets you move another players pawn to your position.
     Dice symbols lets you press your luck. You shall name a number between 1 and 9 and spin the counter. Depending on the result, you either move forward twice the called number, go back twice the called number or move forward even three-times your selected number.

Name: Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Kickstarter Promo Set
Description:
Pixel Tactics is a head-to-head game of tactical combat for two players. Each player has an identical deck of 25 cards, from which they draft a leader. The leader's abilities alter vastly the strategy and playability of every other card in the deck, making the game playable in 25 different ways.

In the game, players take turns placing cards and attacking. Each card can activate in various ways, taking on offensive capabilities in the front rows of the unit, or support powers in the back rows. Cards can also be played as orders – powerful single-time effects that can turn the tide of battle.

Play continues until either player's leader is defeated. A typical game is best of three or five rounds.

Mega Man Pixel Tactics: Kickstarter Promo Set features 5 characters from the Mega Man series which were given out as a surprise to Kickstarter backers.

Name: Game-o-Rama
Description:
Game-o-Rama is a boardgame themed around the annual gaming event held in Atlanta. This print-to-play version is available so gamers can learn the game in advance of the tournament to be held at the next Game-o-Rama (February 2018).

Game-o-Rama is a mancala-style game. Each player has their own board and on their turn they pick up all the pieces in a space and drop them one-per-space (in either a clockwise or counter-clockwise direction) and have an opportunity to score when the pieces in the last space match the icons on one of the cards each player gets. If they match exactly the player gets another turn.

This is a relatively fast and simple to learn game that was called "surprisingly tricky" and "not what we are looking for at this time" by a major boardgame publisher. You will need the cards and player boards to play. Chips, meeples, or cubes can be used for the pieces. A recommended color chart for each icon type is included. More information about the tournament is at the event site.

Name: Principatat
Description:
Principalities is a card game based on the titanic clashes between the Principality of Arberia, the Ottoman Empire and the Republic of Venice. The game has tokens, dice and cards depicting the main historical and political characters of that period. Players will choose the cards and use their features carefully to collect points and triumph over their opponents.

—description from the publisher (English)

PRINCIPATAT është një lojë e bazuar në përleshjen titanike të principatës së Arbërit, perandorisë Osmane dhe republikës së Venedikut. Loja ka xhetona, zara dhe letra që përshkruajnë personazhet kryesore të asaj periudhe. Lojtarët do zgjedhin letrat dhe do përdorin me kujdes veçoritë e tyre për të mbledhur pikë dhe për të triumfuar mbi kundërshtarët.

—description from the publisher (Albanian)

Name: Not Your Game
Description: A CYOA book with a legacy mechanic that allow many players to play with the same book in order to complete the adventure, this is the first episode of a series that explores how CYOA books can improve and mutate by introducing modern game mechanics in it

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Planechase: Elemental Thunder
Description:
Elemental Thunder is a red-green deck.

Planechase was released in 2009.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

To play a game of Planechase, each player needs his or her own planar deck, consisting of at least 10 different oversized cards. The players may also use a "shared planar deck," which requires ten cards per player. Players cannot use more than one plane with any given name. When the game begins, the player going first reveals the top of his or her planar deck (or the shared planar deck), which is the plane the game starts on. Each plane card has a name, a type, one ability that applies at all times (either to all players or to whoever is the turn player at the time), and one "Chaos" ability.

Players also need a six-sided die, called the "planar die." Each Planechase pre-constructed deck comes with a "planar die" that has four blank faces, one "Planeswalk" face with the "Planeswalker" symbol, and one "Chaos" face with its own symbol unique to Planechase. During a player's main phase, that player can roll the planar die, with three possible outcomes. A blank roll of the planar die does nothing. If "Chaos" is rolled, the "Chaos" ability of the current plane card triggers. If the "Planeswalk" symbol is rolled, the player "planeswalks away" from the current plane (put it on the bottom of its owner's planar deck) and he or she reveals the top card of his or her planar deck, which becomes the new plane that has been "planeswalked to." A player can roll the planar die as many times as he or she likes, but successive rolls cost an additional one mana for each time the planar die has been rolled this turn.

Other than the above, the normal rules of the game are followed, and Planechase can be adapted to any multiplayer variant.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Planechase: Metallic Dreams
Description:
Metallic Dreams is a five-color deck built around artifacts.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering  with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Planechase: Strike Force
Description:
Strike Force is a white-red deck.

Name: The "Sir Ross Smith" aeroplane race game
Description: Roll-and-move race board game based on the air race from England to Australia organised by the Australian government in 1919, and won by Sir Ross and Sir Keith Smith in a converted Vickers Vimy bomber. The board features a map of the world, with a path of spaces form England to Australia, and the usual penalties and bonuses en route.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Planechase: Zombie Empire
Description:
Zombie Empire is a black zombie deck

Planechase was originally released in 2009. This deck was released in 2012.

Planechase is a card game and a variant of Magic: The Gathering with an emphasis on multi-player games. The set utilizes new oversized Plane cards, cards that are based on various locations (Planes) within the Magic multiverse, to modify the rules of gameplay.

To play a game of Planechase, each player needs his or her own planar deck, consisting of at least 10 different oversized cards. The players may also use a "shared planar deck," which requires ten cards per player. Players cannot use more than one plane with any given name. Name: Magic: The Gathering – Archenemy: Assemble the Doomsday Machine
Description:
This is a stand-alone one vs. many Magic: The Gathering game.

Assemble the Doomsday Machine is a white-blue-black deck.

Archenemy pits you and your friends against a single powerful foe where you must work together to survive.

Each of the four Archenemy game-packs consists of 20 oversized scheme cards and a 60-card deck.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Archenemy: Trample Civilization Underfoot
Description:
This is a stand-alone one vs. many Magic: The Gathering game.

Trample Civilization Underfoot is a white-green trample deck.

Archenemy pits you and your friends against a single powerful foe where you must work together to survive.

Each of the four Archenemy game-packs consists of 20 oversized scheme cards and a 60-card deck.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Archenemy: Scorch the World with Dragonfire
Description:
This is a stand-alone one vs. many Magic: The Gathering game.

Scorch the World with Dragonfire is a red-green dragon deck.

Archenemy pits you and your friends against a single powerful foe where you must work together to survive.

Each of the four Archenemy game-packs consists of 20 oversized scheme cards and a 60-card deck.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Archenemy: Bring About the Undead Apocalypse
Description:
This is a stand-alone one vs. many Magic: The Gathering game.

Bring About the Undead Apocalypse is a black-red zombie deck.

Archenemy pits you and your friends against a single powerful foe where you must work together to survive.

Each of the four Archenemy game-packs consists of 20 oversized scheme cards and a 60-card deck.

Name: BLOCKCHAIN: The Cryptocurrency Game
Description:
A high-risk, underground movement has started a new economy free from corruption and manipulation. This new world uses cryptocurrency, a financial system based on secure, anonymous exchange and decentralization. This is where you are at the center of your money – mining, trading, and storing digital coins. But where there is hope, there is hacking. How will you protect your fortune on the blockchain?

BLOCKCHAIN is a 2-4 player strategic action-based card game featuring some of the most captivating aspects of cryptocurrency. You’ll mine for opportunities, trade coins based on changing exchange values, and store coins based on your powerful Block cards. The goal is to collect 10 of each type of coin (Bitcoin, Litecoin, Ethereum, Dash, and Peercoin) in cold storage, but the challenge requires some mischievous maneuvers. Learn how to hack or be hacked during every player’s turn, disrupting the entire game strategy. Demonstrate how your clever planning, good timing, and modish moxie will fill your Vault first!

Name: Adorable Monsters: The Super Freaking Awesome Expansion Pack
Description:
It's here. The card game expansion you didn't ask for, but are getting anyway. Introducing...

Adorable Monsters, the Super Freaking Awesome 10 Card Expansion Pack!!!

Dum, da da da, dum, da da dummmmm!!!

10 ALL-NEW characters—each with a different power to affect game play in unique ways!

Name: Stellar Siege
Description:
Brace for Impact! The raging war between the Antillians and the Morkolytes has reached its highest peak.  In a final ferocious siege, the rival aliens battle for control of the star system.  Each species gathers their forces, planet by planet, as tensions grow. In the end, command of the star system can fall under only one dominion, but whose?

Stellar Siege is a 2-player tactical card game in which you play as one of the rival alien species.  You will deploy aliens from your hand into your siege forces at each planet.  Hand management is the key to victory, because the number of cards in your hand dictates to which planet you will deploy your alien that turn.  Outnumbering your opponent at a planet means you conquer it.  At the end of the game, the player who has conquered the most planets wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ingression
Description:
Ingression is a 2 player strategy game in two phases and has a fluid maze that changes each turn through player actions. In the first phase, the Build Phase, players work to build a maze of cards in a 5 x 5 grid.

After the maze is built, the Ingression Phase begins.  Players navigate the maze by creating new paths on the grid.  At the beginning of a turn, a play may draw a new tile and replace a tile already on the board, or turn a tile to create a new path. One of these actions must be taken each turn, and the player also must move if possible.

To win, a player must move their pawn to the other side before their opponent reaches theirs.

The game consists of 39 maze tiles and 2 home tiles, two movement cubes (blank red and blue colored dice), and a small full color instruction manual.  It is designed to be small, portable, and easy to learn.  Ingression can be taught to new players in as little as 5 minutes.  The game does not require much space to play, somewhere between 1 and 2 square feet depending on how the players lay it out.

—description from the publisher

Name: Jewels: Cortigiana
Description:
New promo card for Jewels.

Every player place one token on the Cortigiana card. Then the owner can sell jewels at the given price.

Name: Cartel
Description:
In Cartel, you are a head of one of the biggest drug cartels that want to enrich themselves in the quickest and easiest possible way, that why you will plot against other cartels and try to steal their money or simply destroy it while trying to laundry your own cash. Sometimes you will invest your money in some buildings that will generate you some goods or produce you clean money. Player who will get the most clean cash at the end of the game will be named the greatest drug lord in the world.

Cartel is a small game for 2-4 players with multi use cards  in which you will be fighting other players while building your own drug empire. During the game players will be facing different phases in which they will be bribing some contacts to enter restricted areas, using multi use action cards in few possible ways like: using it for its action, taking them as the goods or connecting them to own empire as buildings that will help us during the game.

There are few interesting mechanics in the game like area control; card management; small engine-building that works very well and with the smart design of multi use cards each and every game is an unique experience.

So do you have what it takes to take the whole drug cartel and show everyone who is the fierce force to be reckoned with?

—description from the publisher

Name: Il Gioco di Cotto e Mangiato
Description:
You are part of the staff who must prepare the recipes for the next episodes of Cotto and Mangiato. When you notice that some essential ingredients for making dishes are not available, you go to the nearby market to try to recover the missing ingredients as quickly as possible, taking them from the available stock of ingredients, as an action.

The game plan represents a market, with 11 stalls, each of which has several products. Each stall is identified by a symbol that determines the type of products on sale.

The player who will be able to complete the higher number of recipes will win the game.

Name: Vero o Falso?
Description:
A fun game for the whole family full of unusual anecdotes. Are you ready to play? An exciting challenge awaits you!

The game proceed with a series of questions and challenges on the general culture, sports, arts, comics, movie etc.

The player that will answer the most correct questions will win the game.
